Meteor.methods.name: Meteor.methods
Meteor.methods.description:
Most communication with Velocity core is done via the following
Meteor methods.

Velocity.name: Velocity
Velocity.description:
The `Velocity` object provides a common API for test frameworks to report
test results.  Frameworks can also request assets, such as a copy of the
user's application (the 'mirror') in which tests can be safely run without
impacting on-going development.

Test results and log activity are reported via
{{#crossLink "Meteor.methods"}}Meteor methods{{/crossLink}}.

classitems.description:
Starts a new mirror if it has not already been started, and reuses an
existing one if it is already started.

This method will update the `VelocityMirrors` collection with once the mirror is ready.
classitems.name: velocity/mirrors/request

props.name: framework
props.description: The name of the calling framework

props.name: testsPath
props.description:
The path to tests for this framework.
                                         For example "jasmine/server/unit".
                                         Don't include a leading or trailing slash.

props.name: args
props.description:
Additional arguments that the mirror is called with
                                         It accepts all the options that are available for `meteor run`.

props.name: env
props.description: Additional environment variables that the mirror is called with.

props.name: port
props.description: String use a specific port

props.name: rootUrlPath
props.description:
Adds this string to the end of the root url in the
                                         VelocityMirrors collection. eg. `/?jasmine=true`

props.name: nodes
props.description:
The number of mirrors required. This is used by
                                         distributable frameworks. Default is 1

props.name: handshake
props.description:
Specifies whether or not this mirror should perform
                                         a DDP handshake with the parent. Distributable
                                         frameworks can use this to get mirrors to behave
                                         like workers. The default is true

classitems.description:
Stores metadata about the mirror.
Before a mirror implementation starts, it needs to call
this method to let Velocity know it is starting up.
classitems.name: velocity/mirrors/init

props.name: port
props.description: The port this mirror is running on

props.name: framework
props.description:
The name of the test framework
                                    making the request

props.name: mongoUrl
props.description: The mongo url this mirror is using

props.name: host
props.description:
The root url of this mirror without any
                       additional paths. Used for making DDP connections

props.name: rootUrl
props.description:
The root url of this mirror, which also
                          includes the path and params

props.name: rootUrlPath
props.description:
Adds this string to the end of
                          the root url in the VelocityMirrors
                          collection. To be used by test frameworks to
                          recognize when they are executing in a mirror.
                          eg. `/?jasmine=true`

params.name: extra
params.description:
Any additional metadata the implementing mirror
                      would like to store in the Velocity mirrors
                      collection. This is optional.

classitems.description: Lets Velocity know the mirror has started successfully
classitems.name: velocity/mirrors/register

props.name: port
props.description: The port this mirror is running on

props.name: framework
props.description:
The name of the test framework
                                    making the request

props.name: host
props.description:
The root url of this mirror without any
                       additional paths. Used for making DDP connections

classitems.description:
Exposes the IS_MIRROR flag to code that is *not* running in a mirror
(ie. the velocity core process that kicks off the mirrors).
classitems.name: velocity/isMirror

return.description: true if currently running in mirror

classitems.description: Returns the MongoDB URL for the given database.
classitems.name: _getMongoUrl

classitems.description: Return URL for the mirror with the given port.
classitems.name: _getMirrorUrl

classitems.description: Return the environment variables that a mirror should run with
classitems.name: _getEnvironmentVariables

props.name: framework
props.description:
The name of the test framework
                                    making the request

props.name: port
props.description: The port this mirror is running on

props.name: rootUrl
props.description:
The root url of this mirror, which also
                          includes the path and params

props.name: host
props.description:
The root url of this mirror without any
                       additional paths. Used for making DDP connections

props.name: rootUrl
props.description:
The root url of this mirror, which also
                          includes the path and params

props.name: rootUrlPath
props.description:
Adds this string to the end of
                          the root url in the VelocityMirrors
                          collection. To be used by test frameworks to
                          recognize when they are executing in a mirror.
                          eg. `/?jasmine=true`

classitems.description:
Exposes the IS_MIRROR flag to code that *is* running in a mirror
(ie. the test framework code that is running the actual tests).
classitems.name: velocity/isMirror

return.description: true if currently running in mirror

classitems.description:
Meteor method: velocity/parentHandshake
This is the best indicator of the mirror's ready status, so it's used to inform the user
when there may be delays
classitems.name: velocity/parentHandshake

Mirrors can share the same codebase as the main process.
This method will run provided code inside a mirror only.

classitems.description:
Run code when Velocity is started. Velocity is considered started when the file watcher has
completed the scan of the  file system

return.description: A function to run on startup

postProcessors

classitems.description:
Add a callback which will execute after all tests have completed
and after the aggregate test results have been reported.
classitems.name: addPostProcessor

classitems.description:
Get a message that displays where bugs in Velocity core itself should
be reported.
classitems.name: getReportGithubIssueMessage

classitems.description: Registers a testing framework plugin.
classitems.name: registerTestingFramework

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the testing framework.

props.name: regex
props.description:
The regular expression for test files
                   that should be assigned to the testing framework.
                   The path relative to the tests folder is matched
                   against it. Default: "name/.+\.js$" (name is
                   the testing framework name).

props.name: disableAutoReset
props.description:
Velocity's reset cycle
                   will skip reports and logs for this framework.
                   It is up to the framework to clean up its ****!

props.name: sampleTestGenerator
props.description:
sampleTestGenerator
                   returns an array of fileObjects with the following
                   fields:
                     path - String - relative path to place test files
                                     (from PROJECT/tests)
                     contents - String - contents to put in the test file
                                         at the corresponding path

classitems.description: Registers a testing framework plugin via a Meteor method.
classitems.name: velocity/register/framework

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the testing framework.

props.name: regex
props.description:
The regular expression for test files
                   that should be assigned to the testing framework.
                   The path relative to the tests folder is matched
                   against it. Default: "name/.+\.js$" (name is
                   the testing framework name).

props.name: disableAutoReset
props.description:
Velocity's reset cycle
                   will skip reports and logs for this framework.
                   It is up to the framework to clean up its ****!

props.name: sampleTestGenerator
props.description:
sampleTestGenerator
                   returns an array of fileObjects with the following
                   fields:
                     path - String - relative path to place test files
                                     (from PROJECT/tests)
                     contents - String - contents to put in the test file
                                         at the corresponding path

classitems.description: Re-init file watcher and clear all test results.
classitems.name: velocity/reset

classitems.description: Clear all test results.
classitems.name: velocity/reports/reset

props.name: framework
props.description:
The name of a specific framework
                   to clear results for.  Ex. 'jasmine' or 'mocha'

props.name: notIn
props.description:
A list of test Ids which should be kept
                                 (not cleared).  These Ids must match the
                                 ones passed to `velocity/reports/submit`.

classitems.description: Clear all log entries.
classitems.name: velocity/logs/reset

props.name: framework
props.description:
The name of a specific framework
                                      to clear logs for.

classitems.description:
Log a message to the Velocity log store.  This provides a central
location for different reporters to query for test framework log
entries.
classitems.name: velocity/logs/submit

props.name: framework
props.description: The name of the test framework

props.name: message
props.description: The message to log

props.name: level
props.description: Log level.  Ex. 'error'. Default: 'info'

classitems.description:
Record the results of an individual test run; a simple collector of
test data.

The `data` object is stored in its entirety; any field may be passed in.
The optional fields documented here are suggestions based on what the
standard html-reporter supports.  Whether or not a field is actually
used is up to the specific test reporter that the user has installed.
classitems.name: velocity/reports/submit

props.name: name
props.description: Name of the test that was executed.

props.name: framework
props.description:
Name of a testing framework.
                                 For example, 'jasmine' or 'mocha'.

props.name: result
props.description:
The results of the test.  Standard values
                              are 'passed' and 'failed'.  Different test
                              reporters can support other values.  For
                              example, the aggregate tests collection uses
                              'pending' to indicate that results are still
                              coming in.

props.name: id
props.description:
Used to update a specific test result.  If not
                            provided, frameworks can use the
                            `velocity/reports/reset` Meteor method to
                            clear all tests.

props.name: timestamp
props.description:
The time that the test started for this
                                 result.

props.name: duration
props.description: The test duration in milliseconds.

props.name: browser
props.description: Which browser did the test run in?

props.name: failureType
props.description: For example, 'expect' or 'assert'

props.name: failureStackTrace
props.description:
The stack trace associated with
                                           the failure

params.name:
[data.ancestors] The hierarchy of suites and blocks above
                                  this test. For example,
                               ['Template', 'leaderboard', 'selected_name']

classitems.description:
Frameworks must call this method to inform Velocity they have completed
their current test runs. Velocity uses this flag when running in CI mode.
classitems.name: velocity/reports/completed

props.name: framework
props.description: Name of a test framework.  Ex. 'jasmine'

classitems.description:
Copy sample tests from frameworks `sample-tests` directories
to the user's application's `tests` directory.
classitems.name: velocity/copySampleTests

props.name: framework
props.description: Framework name. Ex. 'jasmine', 'mocha'

classitems.description: Initialize the directory/file watcher.
classitems.name: _initFileWatcher

params.name: callback
params.description: Called after the watcher completes its first scan and is ready

classitems.description: Re-init file watcher and clear all test results.
classitems.name: _reset

classitems.description: If any one test has failed, mark the aggregate test result as failed.
classitems.name: _updateAggregateReports
